intro: Coffea brenanii, commonly known as the Abyssinian coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Ethiopia and grows at high altitudes in mountainous regions. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee. It is a shrub that typically reaches heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
